Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. Response: Oliver Murray has been with our sales team for just one year, but he has already made a significant impact. He had a very strong start, quickly demonstrating intelligence, creativity, and a strong work ethic. His ability to generate innovative ideas and avoid mistakes is impressive. One of Oliver’s major contributions was identifying and fixing a product error that saved the company a substantial amount of money. He was named employee of the month twice and received a well-deserved promotion after just six months.

However, there are areas for improvement. Oliver recently missed two important deadlines and failed to communicate with the team, which affected project coordination. While he is exceptionally clever and driven, he would benefit from focusing more on team dynamics and improving communication.

Going forward, Oliver’s goals should include better time management and becoming more of a team player. With these improvements, I’m confident he will continue to grow into a highly effective and well-rounded team member.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Read your manager’s feedback. Redraft your speech with expressions to connect your points together and make it flow more smoothly. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Ladies and Gentlemen,

Today, I am thrilled to share that we have successfully renewed our partnership with Crum. This achievement is a testament to our team's unwavering dedication and hard work. Moreover, Crum has praised our commitment to quality, which is a wonderful recognition of our efforts.

However, our journey hasn't been without its challenges. Three months ago, we encountered some unresolved defects and other technical hiccups. These issues were like storm clouds on our horizon, threatening to disrupt our progress. But we didn't let them deter us. Instead, we navigated through these turbulent waters by changing our update delivery process and enhancing our Quality Assurance procedures. These improvements have already started to bear fruit, strengthening our bond with Crum.

Looking ahead, we are committed to providing continuous support to prevent any future issues and ensure our customers' satisfaction. We will continue to sail forward, steering clear of any potential obstacles and maintaining our course towards excellence.

Thank you for your attention, and let's keep up the great work!

We will continue to sail forward, steering clear of any potential obstacles and maintaining our course towards excellence. Thank you for your attention, and let's keep up the great work!

text_a:
Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: One crisp autumn night, my friend Alex found himself wandering through the quiet streets of our town, seeking fresh air to clear his mind. Little did he know, an unusual adventure awaited him. 
As he walked, a tantalizing aroma of baking pastries filled the air, guiding him to a quaint bakery that was mysteriously bustling with activity.
Curiosity piqued, Alex approached the bakery and peeked inside. To his astonishment, the interior was alive with customers dressed in styles from the 1920s, all enjoying their treats as if time had folded upon itself. Had I known I'd step into the past, Alex thought, I might have dressed differently!
Compelled by the blend of curiosity and the inviting smell of fresh scones, Alex entered the bakery. Inside, he mingled with the patrons, absorbing stories wrapped in historical flavors. He even received a cherished scone recipe from a kindly old baker.
As the clock struck midnight, the magic unraveled. The lively scene faded, and the bakery returned to its abandoned state. Alex walked away, the taste of the past lingering on his palate, and a remarkable tale to share. Who knew our ordinary town could hide such a magical secret?
text_b: One crisp autumn night, my friend Alex found himself wandering through the quiet streets of our town, seeking fresh air to clear his mind. Little did he know, an unusual adventure awaited him. As he walked, a tantalizing aroma of baking pastries filled the air, guiding him to a quaint bakery that was mysteriously bustling with activity. Curiosity piqued, Alex approached the bakery and peeked inside. To his astonishment, the interior was alive with customers dressed in styles from the 1920s, all enjoying their treats as if time had folded upon itself.Had I known I'd step into the past,Alex thought,I might have dressed differently Compelled by the blend of curiosity and the inviting smell of fresh scones, Alex entered the bakery. Inside, he mingled with the patrons, absorbing stories wrapped in historical flavors. He even received a cherished scone recipe from a kindly old baker. As the clock struck midnight, the magic unraveled. The lively scene faded, and the bakery returned to its abandoned state. Alex walked away, the taste of the past lingering on his palate, and a remarkable tale to share. Who knew our ordinary town could hide such a magical secret?

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity. Response: Contract of Employment

This Agreement is entered into on __________ (date) between:

________________________ (Employer) ("Party A")

and _____________________ (Employee) ("Party B")

Terms of Employment
The employment of Party B shall commence the date hereof and continue for an indefinite term until terminated in accordance with the provisions of this agreement.

Job Title and Description
Party B shall be employed in the capacity of _________________ (job title), the current duties and responsibilities of which are set out in Schedule "A" annexed hereto and forming part of this agreement. These duties and responsibilities may be amended from time to time in the sole discretion of Party A, subject to formal notification of same being provided to Party B.

Working Hours
3.1. You will be required to work a maximum of 40 ordinary working hours per week: 8 ordinary hours per day, 5 days per week.

3.2. Your usual working hours are from 09:00 to 18:00. Party A reserves the right to change your working hours if the need arises.

Probationary period
The parties hereto agree that the initial six (6) month period of this agreement is "probationary" in the following respects:

4.1. Party A shall have an opportunity to assess the performance, attitude, skills and other employment-related attributes and characteristics of Party B. Party B shall have an opportunity to learn about both Party A and the position of employment.

4.2. Either party may terminate the employment relationship at any time during the initial six month period without advance notice or justifiable reason, in which case there will be no continuing obligations of the parties to each other, financial or otherwise.

Salary and Benefits
5.1. In consideration of the services to be provided by him hereunder, Party B, during the term of his employment, shall be paid a fixed annual salary of ________ in equal monthly installments.

5.2. In addition, Party B is entitled to receive benefits in accordance with Party A’s standard benefit package, as amended from time to time.

Confidentiality and Disclosure Clause
You shall not, at any time during the current contract or after the termination of your employment with Party A, divulge to any person any information relating to the trade secrets or trade connections of the company, or any confidential information concerning Party A’s business or affairs without Party A’s consent.

Termination of Employment
7.1. Subsequent to completion of the probationary term of employment referred to in paragraph 4 herein, Party A may terminate the employment of Party B at any time:

(a) for just cause at common law, in which case Party B is not entitled to any advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice;

(b) without just cause, in which case Party A shall provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice equal to 1 month plus 2 weeks per year of completed service with Party A, to a maximum of fifteen (15) months.

7.2. Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks advance notice of his intention to resign.

Jurisdiction
The validity, interpretation, construction and performance of this agreement shall be governed by the Laws of __________.
text_b: Contract of Employment This Agreement is entered into on __________ (date) between: ________________________ (Employer) ("Party A") and _____________________ (Employee) ("Party B") Terms of Employment The employment of Party B shall commence the date hereof and continue for an indefinite term until terminated in accordance with the provisions of this agreement. Job Title and Description Party B shall be employed in the capacity of _________________ (job title), the current duties and responsibilities of which are set out in Schedule "A" annexed hereto and forming part of this agreement. These duties and responsibilities may be amended from time to time in the sole discretion of Party A, subject to formal notification of same being provided to Party B. Working Hours 3.1. You will be required to work a maximum of 40 ordinary working hours per week: 8 ordinary hours per day, 5 days per week. 3.2. Your usual working hours are from 09:00 to 18:00. Party A reserves the right to change your working hours if the need arises. Probationary period The parties hereto agree that the initial six (6) month period of this agreement is "probationary" in the following respects: 4.1. Party A shall have an opportunity to assess the performance, attitude, skills and other employment-related attributes and characteristics of Party B. Party B shall have an opportunity to learn about both Party A and the position of employment. 4.2. Either party may terminate the employment relationship at any time during the initial six month period without advance notice or justifiable reason, in which case there will be no continuing obligations of the parties to each other, financial or otherwise. Salary and Benefits 5.1. In consideration of the services to be provided by him hereunder, Party B, during the term of his employment, shall be paid a fixed annual salary of ________ in equal monthly installments. 5.2. In addition, Party B is entitled to receive benefits in accordance with Party A’s standard benefit package, as amended from time to time. Confidentiality and Disclosure Clause You shall not, at any time during the current contract or after the termination of your employment with Party A, divulge to any person any information relating to the trade secrets or trade connections of the company, or any confidential information concerning Party A’s business or affairs without Party A’s consent. Termination of Employment 7.1. Subsequent to completion of the probationary term of employment referred to in paragraph 4 herein, Party A may terminate the employment of Party B at any time: (a) for just cause at common law, in which case Party B is not entitled to any advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice; (b) without just cause, in which case Party A shall provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice equal to 1 month plus 2 weeks per year of completed service with Party A, to a maximum of fifteen (15) months. 7.2. Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks advance notice of his intention to resign. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words. Response: Hi everyone,

It’s such a pleasure to be here with you tonight for our celebration dinner. This moment is all about recognizing and appreciating everything we’ve achieved together this year. As Thomas Edison once said, “There’s no substitute for hard work.” And in our line of work, that couldn’t be more true.

We all know it wasn’t an easy year,  there were tight deadlines, late nights, and a lot of pressure. But even with all the challenges, we pulled through. We hit our targets, kept things moving, and that’s thanks to the incredible effort and dedication from each of you. I truly appreciate everything you’ve done.

To wrap up, I want to share a quote by Maya Angelou: “Nothing will work unless you do.” It’s a powerful reminder of the impact each of us has, and how far we can go when we keep showing up and giving our best.

Enjoy the evening, you’ve more than earned it!
text_b: Hi everyone, It’s such a pleasure to be here with you tonight for our celebration dinner. This moment is all about recognizing and appreciating everything we’ve achieved together this year. As Thomas Edison once said, “There’s no substitute for hard work.” And in our line of work, that couldn’t be more true. We all know it wasn’t an easy year, there were tight deadlines, late nights, and a lot of pressure. But even with all the challenges, we pulled through. We hit our targets, kept things moving, and that’s thanks to the incredible effort and dedication from each of you. I truly appreciate everything you’ve done. To wrap up, I want to share a quote by Maya Angelou: “Nothing will work unless you do.” It’s a powerful reminder of the impact each of us has, and how far we can go when we keep showing up and giving our best. Enjoy the evening, you’ve more than earned it!

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Now help the scientist with his scientific report by writing the abstract, which should include all of the report's essential information. Use the notes to help you. Write 100-150 words. Response: nan
text_b: A large study has been done about the effect of Sun Valley dam on local sloth species. First of all, advanced PC simulation has been used to test how dam construction and completion will affect the slot species. Different variables, such as area of habitat and food variety, can be affected by the dam. The study showed that both of them will be reduced with the damconstruction. And the sloth population will decline, as a consequence. As this can lead to an ecological cataclysm or even extintion of the sloth, it is recommended to relocate local sloth species to Corona Valley before the construction of the dam.

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: nan
text_b: For CSR Companies have a big impact on society. They should help the communities where they operate. After all, those communities are letting them do business there. It's a two-way street. And it's the same with sustainable operations and fair employee benefits. The former secures future possibilities, and the latter ensures high productivity and low turnover.The reason CSR makes good business sense, the reason it contributes to the bottom line, is because consumers care. Companies with a good CSR record are rewarded by customer loyalty. Consumers are happy, the company performs welland communities around the world benefit.As an integrated part of society, corporations need to conform to social expectations, and that entails helping the community. Against CSR The problem with corporate social responsibility is that corporations don't have social responsibility. Milton Friedman has pointed out that the real responsibility of business is to increase its profits; business is not answerable to society's expectations but to the shareholders'.It's great that corporations are spending huge sums of money on development projects across the world, but these sums of money are usually still inconsiderable relative to total earnings. In this sense, it's still quite a cheap marketing device to buy a good public image.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a trilateral trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Implemented in 1994, NAFTA aimed to reduce trade barriers and facilitate the exchange of goods and services among its member countries.

NAFTA has had a significant impact on the economies of its member countries. The agreement has increased trade volumes, economic growth, and investment opportunities. For example, trade between the US and Mexico has grown from $81 billion in 1993 to over $600 billion today.

Key provisions of NAFTA include:

- Tariff reduction and elimination
- Simplified customs procedures
- Protection of intellectual property rights
- Dispute resolution mechanisms

While NAFTA has faced criticism and challenges, it remains an important trade agreement for North America. Its impact on regional economic integration and cooperation has been substantial, and it continues to shape trade policies and practices in the region.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which builds upon the foundation established by NAFTA and addresses new trade issues, such as digital trade and labor rights.
text_b: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a trilateral trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Implemented in 1994, NAFTA aimed to reduce trade barriers and facilitate the exchange of goods and services among its member countries. NAFTA has had a significant impact on the economies of its member countries. The agreement has increased trade volumes, economic growth, and investment opportunities. For example, trade between the US and Mexico has grown from $81 billion in 1993 to over $600 billion today. Key provisions of NAFTA include: - Tariff reduction and elimination - Simplified customs procedures - Protection of intellectual property rights - Dispute resolution mechanisms While NAFTA has faced criticism and challenges, it remains an important trade agreement for North America. Its impact on regional economic integration and cooperation has been substantial, and it continues to shape trade policies and practices in the region. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which builds upon the foundation established by NAFTA and addresses new trade issues, such as digital trade and labor rights.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write an email to a fellow pilot, telling him or her what happened. Write 70 - 100 words. Response: Subject: Incident on Flight 293 – Nose Gear Failure

Hey Pedro Lucas,

You won’t believe what happened on Flight 293. Right after takeoff, we got a fault warning for the nose gear shock absorber. After a flyby at San Jose, we confirmed the nose wheels were stuck 90° left. We diverted to SFO for its longer runway and better emergency support. Landed without reverse thrust—tires blew out and shredded, but we stayed on centerline. No fire, just burnt rubber. Everyone deplaned safely. Wild day, but solid teamwork.

Catch up soon,
Erick Silva

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Students learning new languages often face a variety of challenges, including linguistic issues like pronunciation, vocabulary, and grammar, as well as psychological barriers like fear of speaking and lack of motivation. Additional challenges include understanding cultural nuances, different dialects, and the demands of listening comprehension. 
Here's a more detailed breakdown of the challenges - 
Pronunciation:
Mastering the sounds of a new language can be difficult, especially if it differs significantly from the student's native language. 
Vocabulary:
Expanding vocabulary to express oneself effectively is a key challenge, especially when facing a large number of words and idioms. 
Grammar:
Understanding and applying the grammatical rules of a new language can be complex, especially if they differ from the student's native language. 
Listening Comprehension:
Understanding native speakers at natural speed, with colloquialisms and various accents, can be difficult. 
Writing Skills:
Producing well-formed sentences and paragraphs with proper punctuation can be challenging. 
Cultural Nuances:
Grasping cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions, which are deeply tied to cultural context, can be complex. 
Different Dialects:
Exposure to different dialects within the target language can lead to confusion.

Additional challenges include understanding cultural nuances, different dialects, and the demands of listening comprehension. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Now write a report comparing the two car designs. Which design do you think you should go with? Persuade your design team to choose one of the designs for next year’s rollout. Write 100-150 words. Response: In today’s fast-paced automotive market, making the right car buying decision can be like navigating a complex maze. With numerous brands, models, specifications, options, colors, packages, and prices to consider, potential car buyers often find themselves overwhelmed by choices.

JATO’s recent survey of 2,500 future car buyers revealed that 29% of people would research online first when buying a new car. This is where car comparison tools can prove to be essential for securing new and repeat business on automotive websites.
1) Streamlining decision-making process
Imagine a customer is in the market for a hatchback and they’re looking at your brand. There are many things for them to consider – from price points to specification requirements – so having the right information is crucial to support the sales journey.

 

Using a car comparison tool, they can effortlessly access the facts they need, compare your model offering against direct competitors and evaluate specifications side by side. From engine performance and fuel efficiency to safety features and advanced technology, they will have a comprehensive overview that highlights key advantages and differences.

 

This information gives customers clarity and helps to simplify the decision-making process.
 Enhancing transparency and trust
Transparency is a cornerstone of modern business practices. By offering a car comparison tool, your brand can demonstrate its commitment to providing potential buyers with an honest and unbiased evaluation of their offerings. This fosters trust and reinforces the brand’s credibility – both crucial factors in building lasting customer relationships, recommendations, and repeat business.

 

3) Customisation tailored to individual preferences
Car comparison tools go beyond listing features. They allow potential buyers to explore the various options, colours, and packages available for each model. This means that a buyer can seamlessly experiment with different specifications according to their preferences, budget, and what is available in the market today.

 

According to JATO’s recent research, the top options people like to add if they have remaining budget are safety features (parking sensors, lane assist etc.). Therefore, a car comparison tool that allows customers to compare safety options from multiple brands – from price to capability – can enhance the customer experience.

 

Offering high levels of customisation and direct access to information gives the car buyer more power, ensuring that the final purchase aligns with their preferences and requirements.

 

4) Offering a digital first experience
The car buying journey has previously involved extensive research, various dealership visits, and test drives. Today, car comparison tools enable brands and customers to streamline the initial research phase, saving valuable time and energy. Customers browsing your website can now conveniently access all the information they need in one place, making the process more efficient and increasing customer satisfaction.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: Buying a home is a significant milestone and often involves a comprehensive process that begins with thorough research and planning. The first step is to assess your financial situation, considering factors such as income, savings, and credit score, all of which influence your borrowing capacity. Once you have a clear picture of your budget, it's essential to explore different neighborhoods and types of homes to find the one that best suits your lifestyle and needs. Concurrently, applying for a home loan becomes a crucial part of this journey.  securing a home loan is a pivotal step in the process. Begin by investigating different lenders and loan products, focusing on interest rates, fees, and terms. Obtaining pre-approval for a loan is highly recommended, as it not only sharpens your budget but also demonstrates to sellers that you are a committed purchaser. The application process requires you to submit documents such as proof of income, employment details, and identification, while the lender assesses your creditworthiness. Carefully review all terms and conditions before agreeing to any loan. Once you receive approval, you can confidently make an offer on your preferred home, reassured by the financial support to facilitate your investment in a new property.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: The question of whether companies have a responsibility to society or if their primary obligation lies solely with shareholders is a complex and highly debated issue. I firmly believe that companies do have a responsibility to society, and this perspective aligns with the growing movement toward corporate social responsibility (CSR). First of all, companies are integral parts of the communities in which they operate. They benefit from the resources, infrastructure, and workforce that these communities provide. Businesses thrive in environments that are stable, sustainable, and supportive. Therefore, it is not only ethical but also pragmatic for companies to engage in practices that uplift their communities. This two-way relationship fosters goodwill and can enhance company's reputation, leading to increased customer loyalty and, ultimately, better financial performance.
Furthermore, the modern consumer is increasingly aware and concerned about social and environmental issues. As noted by Jack@MSU, a strong CSR record can significantly influence consumer choices. Companies that demonstrate a commitment to ethical practices and social responsibility often enjoy enhanced brand loyalty and, consequently, improved sales. This suggests that doing good and doing well are not mutually exclusive but can go hand-in-hand.
On the other hand, the arguments against CSR, such as those presented by Milton Friedman and others, emphasize a more traditional view that prioritizes shareholder profit above all else. While it is essential for businesses to be profitable, this narrow focus can lead to short-term thinking and potentially harmful practices that disregard the broader implications of their operations on society and the environment. Moreover, the argument that it is the government's 
role to enforce social responsibility fails to acknowledge that businesses have a unique opportunity to drive positive change. Many societal issues can be more effectively addressed by innovative corporate strategies rather than relying solely on regulatory frameworks. Companies have the resources and influence to implement impactful initiatives that address social challenges directly, thereby contributing to a more sustainable future. In conclusion, I believe that companies not only have a responsibility to their shareholders but also to the societies in which they operate. By embracing CSR, businesses can build stronger relationships with their communities, enhance their brand reputation, and ultimately drive sustainable success.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Robots are used extensively in India. They are employed in the automotive and electronics industries to enhance precision and efficiency, thereby reducing costs and improving production. Many farmers have started using automated machines for irrigation and harvesting. In fact, the Indian government supports these farmers who use modern technology by providing them with interest-free loans. Over the past decade, the healthcare industry has also accommodated robots to assist in surgeries and research. Educational institutions are incorporating robotics into their curricula to prepare students for a technology-driven future. The increasing presence of robots in service sectors, such as cleaning and delivery, is reshaping daily life and consumer expectations. The societal impact of robotics in India is multifaceted; while it boosts economic growth and technological advancement, it also raises concerns over job displacement and the need for reskilling the workforce.

I am not really sure how I feel about robots. I am excited yet skeptical about them. I am eager to try new technology but skeptical about how dependent I will become on it.

Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words. Response: Ladies and gentlemen,

I want to take this opportunity to extend my deepest gratitude to all our staff. Your dedication, hard work, and perseverance have been nothing short of inspiring. As Winston Churchill wisely said, "It is the courage to continue that counts." This year, we faced numerous challenges and obstacles, but thanks to your unwavering commitment, we managed to achieve our goals, albeit just barely.

However, we must not become complacent. The fact that we reached our targets shows our potential, but it also highlights areas where we can improve. Let us use this experience as a stepping stone to aim even higher next year. With the same spirit and determination, I am confident that we can achieve even greater success.

Thank you once again for your incredible efforts. Let's continue to push forward and make the upcoming year our best yet.
text_b: Ladies and gentlemen, I want to take this opportunity to extend my deepest gratitude to all our staff. Your dedication, hard work, and perseverance have been nothing short of inspiring. As Winston Churchill wisely said, "It is the courage to continue that counts." This year, we faced numerous challenges and obstacles, but thanks to your unwavering commitment, we managed to achieve our goals, albeit just barely. However, we must not become complacent. The fact that we reached our targets shows our potential, but it also highlights areas where we can improve. Let us use this experience as a stepping stone to aim even higher next year. With the same spirit and determination, I am confident that we can achieve even greater success. Thank you once again for your incredible efforts. Let's continue to push forward and make the upcoming year our best yet.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Look at your notes then write to your manager, Samantha. Describe what will be in your speech. Use a soft but confident tone. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: We are excited about the renewed partnership with Crum, a reflection to our dedication to quality. This success follows a period of unresolved defects and other technical issues that we encountered three months ago.
We have implemented significant changes to update our delivery system and enhanced our Quality Assurance processes to ensure that such problems are quickly addressed in the future.
Crum has appreciated our efforts and commitment to maintaining high standards. Looking forward, we will continue to support and collaborate with Crum to prevent any further issues, ensuring customer satisfaction and strengthening our partnership.
Customers are key to our business and it will always be our priority to support them whenever they face any issues. Together, we aim to build a robust and reliable system that upholds the excellence both companies strive for. Thank you for your continued trust and cooperation as we advance towards a brighter and more efficient future.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: When it comes to choosing favorite cities, New York City is always at the top of my list. The Big Apple is a whirlwind of energy, with its iconic skyline, diverse culture, and endless possibilities. It's the kind of place where you can find yourself eating a bagel in Central Park in the morning, visiting the Met in the afternoon, and catching a Broadway show by night. The city is a living, breathing entity, always on the move. The subway system, though sometimes chaotic, is a lifeline that connects the city's vibrant neighborhoods, each with its own unique flavor.

On the flip side, Tokyo offers a completely different but equally captivating experience. The first thing that strikes you about Tokyo is its incredible blend of the ultramodern and the traditional. One moment you're in the neon-lit streets of Shibuya, surrounded by towering digital billboards, and the next, you're in a serene temple in Asakusa, taking in the tranquility. Tokyo’s public transportation is a marvel of efficiency and cleanliness, making it easy to explore every corner of the city. The food scene is another highlight, with everything from world-class sushi to comforting bowls of ramen.

New York and Tokyo are both dynamic cities, but they offer different vibes. New York is all about diversity and cultural richness; it's a place where you can experience the world in a single city. Tokyo, on the other hand, impresses with its seamless integration of cutting edge technology and deeprooted traditions. Each city has its own unique charm and leaves a lasting impression, making them both top destinations on any traveler's list.
text_b: When it comes to choosing favorite cities, New York City is always at the top of my list. The Big Apple is a whirlwind of energy, with its iconic skyline, diverse culture, and endless possibilities. It's the kind of place where you can find yourself eating a bagel in Central Park in the morning, visiting the Met in the afternoon, and catching a Broadway show by night. The city is a living, breathing entity, always on the move. The subway system, though sometimes chaotic, is a lifeline that connects the city's vibrant neighborhoods, each with its own unique flavor. On the flip side, Tokyo offers a completely different but equally captivating experience. The first thing that strikes you about Tokyo is its incredible blend of the ultramodern and the traditional. One moment you're in the neon-lit streets of Shibuya, surrounded by towering digital billboards, and the next, you're in a serene temple in Asakusa, taking in the tranquility. Tokyo’s public transportation is a marvel of efficiency and cleanliness, making it easy to explore every corner of the city. The food scene is another highlight, with everything from world-class sushi to comforting bowls of ramen. New York and Tokyo are both dynamic cities, but they offer different vibes. New York is all about diversity and cultural richness; it's a place where you can experience the world in a single city. Tokyo, on the other hand, impresses with its seamless integration of cuttingedge technology and deeprooted traditions. Each city has its own unique charm and leaves a lasting impression, making them both top destinations on any traveler's list.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. Response: On June 15, 2025, Cessna 123 experienced minor complications during its landing at Springfield Regional Airport. During final approach, the aircraft encountered unexpected crosswind gusts up to 18 knots, which affected alignment with Runway 27. The aircraft made a hard landing, resulting in a bounce and a brief veer to the left before the pilot regained full control. No injuries were reported, and the aircraft taxied safely to the gate.

Preliminary checks suggest possible minor issues with the nose gear shock absorption system. Weather conditions were within operational limits, but the gusts were stronger than forecasted. The flight crew followed standard procedures and responded promptly to the situation.

The aircraft has been temporarily grounded for a full inspection. Further investigation is underway to determine whether any mechanical or procedural factors contributed to the incident. Recommendations will be issued following the maintenance report.
text_b: On June 15, 2025, Cessna 123 experienced minor complications during its landing at Springfield Regional Airport. During final approach, the aircraft encountered unexpected crosswind gusts up to 18 knots, which affected alignment with Runway 27. The aircraft made a hard landing, resulting in a bounce and a brief veer to the left before the pilot regained full control. No injuries were reported, and the aircraft taxied safely to the gate. Preliminary checks suggest possible minor issues with the nose gear shock absorption system. Weather conditions were within operational limits, but the gusts were stronger than forecasted. The flight crew followed standard procedures and responded promptly to the situation. The aircraft has been temporarily grounded for a full inspection. Further investigation is underway to determine whether any mechanical or procedural factors contributed to the incident. Recommendations will be issued following the maintenance report.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 10.0 Prompt: Read the email from your manager. Then respond with an email that has several ideas to help her solve the budget problem. Type in the input box. Write between 80 and 100 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: Hi! I'm sorry to hear about the budget crisis, but I’m happy to help brainstorm ideas for cutting costs. Below is a comprehensive list of potential cost-saving measures across various areas. You can adapt these ideas to fit your specific situation, whether it’s for a business, government, nonprofit, or personal budget.

---

General Cost-Cutting Strategies**
Conduct a Spending Audit**: Identify and eliminate unnecessary expenses by reviewing all expenditures.
Prioritize Spending**: Focus on essential expenses and delay or cut non-essential ones.
Renegotiate Contracts**: Revisit contracts with vendors, suppliers, and service providers to negotiate better terms or discounts.
4. *to reduce costs (e.g., using one provider for multiple needs).
5. **Implement a Hiring Freeze**: Temporarily halt hiring and rely on existing staff.
6. **Reduce Overtime**: Limit overtime hours and encourage efficient scheduling.
7. **Outsource Non-Core Functions**: Consider outsourcing tasks like IT, payroll, or cleaning to reduce overhead.

---

### **Operational Efficiency**
8. **Go Paperless**: Reduce printing and paper costs by transitioning to digital processes.
9. **Energy Efficiency**: Lower utility bills by switching to energy-efficient lighting, appliances, and HVAC systems.
10. **Remote Work**: Reduce office space and utility costs by allowing remote work where possible.
11. **Streamline Processes**: Identify and eliminate inefficiencies in workflows to save time and money.
12. **Automate Tasks**: Use software or tools to automate repetitive tasks and reduce labor costs.

---

### **Personnel and Labor Costs**
13. **Reduce Staff Hours**: Implement part-time schedules or furloughs instead of layoffs.
14. **Cross-Train Employees**: Train employees to handle multiple roles, reducing the need for additional hires.
15. **Voluntary Pay Cuts**: Offer voluntary pay reduction programs for higher-paid employees.
16. **Unpaid Leave**: Allow employees to take unpaid leave if they are willing.
17. **Freeze Bonuses and Raises**: Temporarily suspend bonuses, raises, or other discretionary compensation.

---

### **Technology and IT**
18. **Switch to Open-Source Software**: Use free or low-cost open-source software instead of expensive licenses.
19. **Cancel Unused Subscriptions**: Review and cancel unused software, apps, or services.
20. **Extend Hardware Life**: Delay upgrading computers and equipment until absolutely necessary.
21. **Cloud Migration**: Move to cloud-based services to reduce IT infrastructure costs.

---

### **Marketing and Advertising**
22. **Shift to Digital Marketing**: Reduce traditional advertising (e.g., print, TV) and focus on cost-effective digital channels.
23. **Leverage Social Media**: Use free or low-cost social media platforms for promotion.
24. **Reduce Ad Spend**: Pause or reduce paid advertising campaigns.
25. **Focus on ROI**: Prioritize marketing efforts with the highest return on investment.

---

### **Facilities and Office Space**
26. **Downsize Office Space**: Move to a smaller office or shared workspace.
27. **Sublease Unused Space**: Rent out unused office space to other businesses.
28. **Reduce Maintenance Costs**: Negotiate lower rates with cleaning and maintenance providers.
29. **Cancel Unused Memberships**: End memberships to clubs, associations, or gyms that are not essential.

---

### **Travel and Transportation**
30. **Limit Business Travel**: Use video conferencing tools instead of in-person meetings.
31. **Encourage Carpooling or Public Transit**: Reduce transportation costs for employees.
32. **Negotiate Travel Discounts**: Work with airlines, hotels, and car rental companies for corporate discounts.
33. **Downsize Fleet**: Sell or lease unused company vehicles.

---

### **Supplies and Inventory**
34. **Reduce Inventory Levels**: Avoid overstocking and focus on just-in-time inventory management.
35. **Bulk Purchasing**: Negotiate discounts for buying in bulk.
36. **Switch to Generic Brands**: Use generic or lower-cost supplies where possible.
37. **Donate or Sell Excess Inventory**: Clear out unused items to free up space and generate revenue.

---

### **Revenue Generation and Alternative Funding**
38. **Increase Prices**: If feasible, raise prices slightly to improve margins.
39. **Offer Discounts for Early Payments**: Encourage customers to pay early by offering small discounts.
40. **Sell Assets**: Sell unused equipment, property, or other assets.
41. **Apply for Grants or Funding**: Seek grants, subsidies, or low-interest loans.
42. **Crowdfunding**: Use crowdfunding platforms to raise funds for specific projects.

---

### **Customer and Client Focus**
43. **Focus on High-Value Clients**: Prioritize serving clients or customers who generate the most revenue.
44. **Reduce Discounts**: Limit or eliminate discounts and promotions that erode profit margins.
45. **Improve Collections**: Tighten credit policies and follow up on overdue payments.

---

Long-Term Strategic Changes**
better terms with creditors.
Merge or Partner**: Explore mergers, partnerships, or collaborations to share costs.
Diversify Revenue Streams**: Develop new products or services to generate additional income.
Invest in Training**: Train employees to improve productivity and reduce errors.
Exit Unprofitable Markets**: Discontinue products, services, or operations that are not profitable.

---

Nonprofit-Specific Ideas**
Reduce Program Costs**: Streamline programs to focus on the most impactful activities.
Volunteer Support**: Recruit volunteers to replace paid staff where possible.
Collaborate with Other Organizations**: Share resources or co-host events to reduce costs.
Cut Administrative Costs**: Reduce overhead by simplifying administrative processes.

---

Freeze Non-Essential Projects**: Delay or cancel projects that are not critical.
Reduce Public Services Temporarily**: Cut back on non-essential services until the crisis passes.
Increase Efficiency in Public Programs**: Streamline processes to reduce waste.
Public-Private Partnerships**: Partner with private companies to share costs for public projects.

---

Personal Budget Crisis Ideas
 Cut Discretionary Spending**: Reduce spending on entertainment, dining out, and non-essential items.
 Downsize Housing**: Move to a smaller home or apartment to reduce rent or mortgage payments.
Cancel Subscriptions**: End unused streaming services, magazines, or gym memberships.
Use Public Transportation**: Save on gas and car maintenance by using public transit.
Cook at Home**: Reduce food costs by preparing meals at home instead of eating out.

---

Creative and Unconventional Ideas**
Barter Services**: Exchange services with other businesses or individuals instead of paying cash.
65. **Crowdsource Solutions**: Ask employees, customers, or the community for cost-saving ideas.
66. **Host Virtual Events**: Replace in-person events with virtual ones to save on venue and catering costs.
67. **Repurpose Materials**: Find creative ways to reuse existing materials or resources.
68. **Offer Equity**: In lieu of cash payments, offer equity or profit-sharing to vendors or employees.

---

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Look at your notes then write to your manager, Samantha. Describe what will be in your speech. Use a soft but confident tone. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Subject: Upcoming Speech Outline
Hi Samantha,
I wanted to share a brief overview of my upcoming speech.
I'll begin by highlighting our success in renewing the partnership with Crum, emphasizing their praise for our team's commitment to quality.

Then, I'll address the challenges we faced, notably the unresolved defectrs from three months ago and some minor tech issues. I'll explain how we took immediate action to address these concerns.

For the solution, I'll focus on the improvements we've made, including a change in our update delivery system and strengthened Quality Assurance processes. These steps ensure the issues would not recur in the future.

To close, I'll look ahead, reassuring the team that we're committed to providing further support to avoid any future problems and to continue meeting customer expectations.

Please let me know if you'd like me to adjust anything

Best regards,
Joydeep

Prompt Level: 10.0 Prompt: An old friend has emailed you, describing what he's been doing for the last decade. Pretend you have two kids living abroad, and write a response describing what they have been doing. Type in the input box. Write 50-100 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: Hi John, I got your contact from our old friend Bob. I can't believe we haven't seen each other in 15 years, since we lived on the same street. A lot has happened to me in the last few years.
Let's schedule a meeting to get closer. I know you have children, and I have children too. Let's schedule a barbecue so they can meet and we can talk.
Regards.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the terms of a contract to your boss, Mr. Kent. Write 75–150 words. Response: To the attention of Mr. Kent

SUMMARY OF CONTRACT FOR THE SALE OF GOODS


A. IDENTITIES OF THE PARTIES
Design Inc. acting as Seller, and Green Solutions as Buyer

B. DESCRIPTION OF THE GOODS
Seller agrees to transfer and deliver to Buyer, on or before 30 September 2017, the goods described below:
. Xu Console desk x 250.

C. BUYER’S RIGHTS AND OBLIGAT
- Half payment due upon receipt of goods, with full payment due within 30 days of delivery.

Goods are deemed received by Buyer upon delivery to Buyer’s address indicated in the contract.

Buyer has the right to examine the goods and has 21 days to notify seller of any claim for damages.

Failure to provide such notice constitutes acceptance of the goods.

D. SELLER’S OBLIGATIONS
Until received by Buyer, all risk of loss to the described goods is borne by Seller

E. ATTESTATION
Agreed on 15 Junio 2017

By: Clark Philips – General Manager as Seller

By: Director of Finance of Green Solutions as Buyer

DESCRIPTION OF THE GOODS Seller agrees to transfer and deliver to Buyer, on or before 30 September 2017, the goods described below: . Xu Console desk x 250. C. BUYER’S RIGHTS AND OBLIGAT - Half payment due upon receipt of goods, with full payment due within 30 days of delivery. Goods are deemed received by Buyer upon delivery to Buyer’s address indicated in the contract. Buyer has the right to examine the goods and has 21 days to notify seller of any claim for damages. Failure to provide such notice constitutes acceptance of the goods. D. SELLER’S OBLIGATIONS Until received by Buyer, all risk of loss to the described goods is borne by Selle E. ATTESTATION Agreed on 15 Junio 201 By: Clark Philips – General Manager as Seller By: Director of Finance of Green Solutions as Buyer

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: **Flight 293 Incident Summary Report**

On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293, a scheduled domestic passenger service, was forced to execute an emergency landing at San Francisco International Airport (SFO) due to a critical mechanical failure involving the aircraft’s nose landing gear. The Airbus, carrying 141 passengers and six crew members, initially departed Oakland, California at 15:31, bound for Phoenix, Arizona. However, shortly after takeoff, the flight crew received a fault warning regarding the nose landing gear shock absorber and nose wheel steering system.

While the aircraft’s climb appeared normal at first, the cockpit's control panel displayed concerning error messages. In response, the captain diverted the flight to San Jose, California, where air traffic controllers, airline ground personnel, and a nearby news helicopter visually confirmed that the nose wheels were locked 90 degrees to the left — a potentially hazardous configuration for landing.

Recognizing the severity of the situation, the captain made the strategic decision to divert again, this time to SFO, which offered superior runway length, optimal surface conditions, and enhanced emergency services. To minimize risk upon landing, the crew flew in holding patterns for several hours to reduce fuel weight.

In preparation for a potentially dangerous touchdown, the captain informed the cabin crew of the gear malfunction and advised that passengers would evacuate through the rear exits in case of a nose gear collapse. The crew maintained clear communication with the passengers, calmly preparing them for emergency procedures without causing panic.

During final approach, the captain skillfully controlled the descent, touching down at approximately 120 knots. He delayed nose gear contact for as long as possible, applying normal braking at 90 knots. The engines were shut down at 60 knots to prevent complications. The flight crew deliberately avoided using reverse thrust or automatic braking systems to maintain greater manual control. Upon ground contact, the nose tires rapidly deteriorated, shredding and exposing the axle, though the aircraft’s trajectory remained stable throughout.

Though the forward cabin crew reported the smell of burning rubber during deceleration, the control tower quickly confirmed that there was no fire on board. Following this reassurance, the aircraft came to a safe stop, and passengers disembarked calmly via an air stair, without injuries or further incident.

Despite the severe nose gear malfunction, the flight crew’s professionalism, precision, and calm under pressure ensured the safety of all on board. The incident stands as a textbook example of decisive leadership, effective communication, and expert airmanship in the face of a mechanical emergency.
text_b: **Flight 293 Incident Summary Report** On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293, a scheduled domestic passenger service, was forced to execute an emergency landing at San Francisco International Airport (SFO) due to a critical mechanical failure involving the aircraft’s nose landing gear. The Airbus, carrying 141 passengers and six crew members, initially departed Oakland, California at 15:31, bound for Phoenix, Arizona. However, shortly after takeoff, the flight crew received a fault warning regarding the nose landing gear shock absorber and nose wheel steering system. While the aircraft’s climb appeared normal at first, the cockpit's control panel displayed concerning error messages. In response, the captain diverted the flight to San Jose, California, where air traffic controllers, airline ground personnel, and a nearby news helicopter visually confirmed that the nose wheels were locked 90 degrees to the left — a potentially hazardous configuration for landing. Recognizing the severity of the situation, the captain made the strategic decision to divert again, this time to SFO, which offered superior runway length, optimal surface conditions, and enhanced emergency services. To minimize risk upon landing, the crew flew in holding patterns for several hours to reduce fuel weight. In preparation for a potentially dangerous touchdown, the captain informed the cabin crew of the gear malfunction and advised that passengers would evacuate through the rear exits in case of a nose gear collapse. The crew maintained clear communication with the passengers, calmly preparing them for emergency procedures without causing panic. During final approach, the captain skillfully controlled the descent, touching down at approximately 120 knots. He delayed nose gear contact for as long as possible, applying normal braking at 90 knots. The engines were shut down at 60 knots to prevent complications. The flight crew deliberately avoided using reverse thrust or automatic braking systems to maintain greater manual control. Upon ground contact, the nose tires rapidly deteriorated, shredding and exposing the axle, though the aircraft’s trajectory remained stable throughout. Though the forward cabin crew reported the smell of burning rubber during deceleration, the control tower quickly confirmed that there was no fire on board. Following this reassurance, the aircraft came to a safe stop, and passengers disembarked calmly via an air stair, without injuries or further incident. Despite the severe nose gear malfunction, the flight crew’s professionalism, precision, and calm under pressure ensured the safety of all on board. The incident stands as a textbook example of decisive leadership, effective communication, and expert airmanship in the face of a mechanical emergency.

Before concluding, have you got some questions about what I said?

text_a:
Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Move over, werewolves and vampires. There’s a big, richly imaginative and extremely spooky world of desi ghosts, monsters and mythical creatures just waiting to devour…er to be discovered and given their rightful place in popular culture. Some of them can be found crawling through the pages of ancient texts, some adorn temple walls, while the stories of others are told through whispers and hushed songs, their forms changing and twisting with each narration. There are thousands of mythical creatures of Indian origin, but in the interest of space, attention span and potential Halloween costumes, we’ve prepared a list of seven fantastic creatures and where to find them (but hopefully you won’t go looking for them).

Tekhumiavi
The tale of the tekhumiavi or the were-tiger is popular among the Angami tribe of Nagaland. Unlike werewolves, were-tigers don’t transform from human to animal completely. Instead, only the soul of the human shifts to a tiger’s body, while the human body functions normally, albeit soulless for the time being. While in this form, the human behaves just like a tiger, and the human body experiences everything the tiger body does – somewhat like what happens in the Matrix. 

Now, how does one tell a tekhumiavi from a regular tiger? Simple – the were-tiger has five claws instead of four, so you can tell from the pugmarks. So, here’s something to look out for when you’re exploring the hills of Nagaland. 

Tekhumiavi
Penchapenchi
This monster out of Bengali folklore looks like an owl – yes, the dispenser of wisdom in animal stories – but it doesn’t exactly behave like one. A penchapenchi preys on forest dwellers, especially the ones who are foolish to wander off alone. Once the penchapenchi is sure that help is far away, it strikes down its prey and then drains their blood. Whether the victim turns into a penchapenchi (like in the case of a vampire bite) or not is yet to be confirmed.

Penchapenchi
Navagunjara
A mash-up of nine different animals, the navagunjara makes a special appearance in an Odia retelling of the Mahabharata as a manifestation of Vishnu. Story goes that when Arjuna, one of the Pandava princes, was in the middle of a penance, a strange creature appeared before him. Arjuna’s instinctive reaction, because he was terrified, was of course to point an arrow at it. The creature had the neck and head of a peacock, the hump of a bull, the waist of a lion, and the tail of a snake, and it stood on three different kinds of feet – an elephant’s, a horse or a deer’s and a tiger’s. Its fourth limb was human, which held a lotus. Before he let the arrow fly, Arjuna saw the lotus and realised what the creature truly represented. 

Navagunjara
Navagunjara
Naale Ba
An urban legend, mostly based in Karnataka, demands that the words Naale ba or ‘come tomorrow’ be painted outside houses (with no spelling mistakes, mind) to ward off a witch, who likes knocking on doors at night and murdering whoever’s unlucky enough to open them. Thankfully, the witch’s kryptonite seems to be her own politeness.

Naale Ba
Nishi
Monsters really do have a thing for lone travellers, don’t they? The nishi, found mostly in the forests of Bengal, Bihar and Jharkhand, are particularly vicious because they call out to their potential victims in the voice of their loved ones. Once the victims are lured into a well and truly secluded place, the nishi proceeds to kill them. Because they always appear in the distance, the only description we have of them is that they are shadowy creatures. Fortunately,  there is a way to identify these crafty creatures. If you hear the call thrice, you can rest assured that it’s not a nishi, because the ghost can, well, only be bothered to call out twice. The next time a loved one fondly calls out to you twice, there is no need to respond; flee.

Nishi
Gandeberunda
You probably already know the story of Narasimha, Vishnu’s hybrid avatar. Evil demon Hiranyakashipu gets a boon from Brahma that makes him practically invincible, which in turn gives him the licence to terrorize everyone. But when he tries to murder his own son, Vishnu decides that enough is enough and vanquishes Hiranyakashipu in the most creative way (you see, all boons come with loopholes) in his Narasimha avatar.

The story doesn’t end there though. Even with Hiranyakashipu out of the picture, Narasimha is still really, really angry, and afraid that his anger issues would destroy the world, the gods beseech Shiva to do something. Of course, the only way to tackle a powerful mythical creature is to turn into a powerful mythical creature yourself. Shiva becomes Sharabha – a half-lion (to match Narasimha, understandably) and half-bird form (the OG Angry Bird) – and manages to subdue Narasimha. The story is still not over, because Narasimha becomes Angrier Bird – taking on the form of Gandeberunda, a gigantic two-headed bird with Hulk-like strength. Sharabha, thankfully, calls it quits after 18 days of fighting and Gandeberunda also finally calms down. This powerful bird happens to be the state emblem of Karnataka, and the Gandeberunda motif can be found in many places in India, including temple architecture.

Gandeberunda
Decorative motif on the ceiling of Brihadeeswarar temple
Bhoota Vahana Yantra
It appears that robots are quite ancient. According to an 11th-century text, when Buddha died, it fell to King Ajatashatru of Magadha to protect his sacred relics. Ajatashatru concealed the relics in a secret underground chamber in his capital, Pataliputra (now Patna in Bihar). And the warriors who stood guard were automatons, but not just any automatons though. Bhoota Vahana Yantra literally means ‘spirit movement machine’, so these robots had spirits inside them that were responsible for their movements. Needless to say, these robots made excellent guards.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Write a summary of the logistics industry, similar to the one in the previous activity. Compare your text with the model.  Response: Logistics industry.

In my personal point of view, i consider the efficiency of supply chain that includes logistics inbound and outbound a differentiator in companies that aspire to be world class.

Nowadays in such a competitive global environment where we need to deliver products and goods quickly. There are challenges in the area of ​​logistics because the stress that is caused in the system often depends on third parties, incidents that can occur when it comes to international imports or exports.
text_b: Logistics industry. Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Drafted Speech (Metaphor: A Ship Navigating the Sea)

Ladies and gentlemen,

Imagine our company as a ship sailing through unpredictable waters. Each department is a vital crew — the engineers in the engine room, the strategists at the helm, the communicators in the crow’s nest. Together, we steer this vessel toward new horizons.

Of course, storms arise. Some challenges are rough waves that rock us slightly — delays, tight deadlines, or shifting markets. Others are hidden reefs — unexpected costs or internal miscommunication. But with every obstacle, we learn to navigate better.

Our crews — from IT squads to marketing units — have proven their resilience. You've tightened the sails, adjusted the course, and kept us afloat even in turbulent times.

As captain of this journey, I don’t take credit alone. It’s your commitment, your insight, your teamwork that has made the difference.

Let’s continue to read the map together, anticipate the storms, and celebrate each safe harbor we reach.

The ocean ahead is vast, but our compass is strong. And with this crew, I have no doubt — we will reach remarkable destinations.

Thank you.

Acquisition of Smoot Computers

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Among the introduced techniques, free writing and loop writing appear most useful. Free writing allows for a spontaneous and unfettered exploration of ideas, overcoming writer's block and fostering creativity. Loop writing builds upon this by providing a structured framework to refine and develop those initial ideas into coherent narratives. This combination of spontaneity and structure makes it a powerful tool for brainstorming and developing a piece of writing. 
Listing and questioning are also valuable, as they provide a means to organize thoughts and explore different facets of a topic. Listing helps in creating a comprehensive overview, while questioning encourages deeper reflection and analysis. These techniques are particularly helpful for organizing thoughts before drafting a piece and for ensuring that all relevant aspects of a topic are considered.

many different approaches of teaching these organizational and critical skills with freewriting. Peter Elbow and Lynn Hammond both use freewriting in their classes in similar manners. Elbow went through three bouts of teaching before settling on the style he uses today. The first bout occurred during his graduate year at M.I.T. where he "simply tried to imitate the good teachers (he had) had—to be Socrates and a good guy at the same time" (Embracing Contraries 67). After teaching in this manner for five years, he went through a "why should I tell them anything if they don't ask me questions" stage, in which he taught his classes (sophomore level) based on a three step system. First the students had to state on paper three times during the year what the expected to learn or what they had learned. Each student pursued his/her own goals with only constraints of reality to steer their learning. Second, all students read either a work of literature, or something about literature each week, and third, they all had to write something on paper and put it in a box where all the other students could read it and make comments (Contraries 71). This process sounds similar to our e-mail usage in 5360. Finally, after becoming fed up with the above two methods of teaching, Elbow embraced his first and second order thinking technique. He states that his agenda for the beginning of a semester is "always to enforce generating and brainstorming and the deferral of criticism in order to build students' confidence and show

They follow all the other festivals as well with great joy and pride.

Bangalore is also a centre of renowned colleges, academic institutions, important central government establishments, scientific and research institutes and organisations such as the Indian Institute of Science (IISc), Indian Institute of Management (Bangalore) (IIMB), and National Institute of Mental Health and Neurosciences (NIMHANS).Major tourist destinations include Cubbon Park, Botanical Garden Lalbagh, Bangalore Palace, Nandi or Bull temple, etc.I love the city because of its pleasant weather. But, due to global warming, the city’s climate is seeing a change and getting hotter during the summer. There is no humidity, mostly breezy and cloudy, and you feel that slight cold most of the time.

Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: I like metaphors in literature as its easier to understand the thought better.

Here are some examples of metaphors in literature:
"Hope" is the thing with feathers
In this poem, the speaker compares her hope to a bird that flies within her. The metaphor suggests that hope can provide encouragement even during dark times. 
"All the world's a stage"
In As You Like It by William Shakespeare, the speaker compares the world to a stage, and people to players. 
"America is a melting pot"
John de Crevecoeur used this metaphor to describe the fusion of nationalities in the United States. 
"The fog comes on little cat feet"
In Carl Sandburg's poem "Fog", the speaker compares fog to a cat to show how fog acts aloof, silently invades towns, and creates a sense of mystery. 
"A wolf in sheep's clothing"
In the Bible, this metaphor is used to describe how people present themselves to others.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Comparing New York City and Tokyo

New York City, often referred to as "The Big Apple," is a bustling metropolis known for its vibrant culture and towering skyscrapers. The city thrives on its fast-paced lifestyle, with people constantly on the move. The energy in NYC is palpable, whether you're walking through Times Square or riding the subway. It’s a melting pot of cultures, and this diversity is reflected in its food, neighborhoods, and festivals. The iconic skyline, featuring landmarks like the Empire State Building, gives the city a unique, unmistakable character.

On the other hand, Tokyo, Japan, offers a very different but equally fascinating experience. The city blends modern technology with traditional customs, making it a unique fusion of old and new. While the streets of Tokyo are just as busy as New York’s, there’s a sense of calm in the midst of all the hustle. Tokyo’s meticulous organization is evident in its efficient public transport system and the careful balance of green spaces amid urban sprawl. Unlike NYC’s chaotic energy, Tokyo's vibe is more orderly yet still vibrant, offering a serene escape in its parks and temples.

Both cities offer remarkable experiences, but while New York pulses with raw energy and diversity, Tokyo provides a harmonious blend of tradition and modernity.

The city thrives on its fast-paced lifestyle, with people constantly on the move. The energy in NYC is palpable, whether you're walking through Times Square or riding the subway. It’s a melting pot of cultures, and this diversity is reflected in its food, neighborhoods, and festivals. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You're asked to prepare the script for the opening of a presentation about your company. Write the script based on the email. Include a self-introduction, hook and outline. Write 80–175 words. Response: Good morning everyone,

It’s a real pleasure to be here with you today. For those of you I haven’t met yet, my name is Ana, and I work as Business Consultant here at BonVoyager. Thank you for taking the time to join us – it’s great to see so many new faces in the room.

Today, I’d like to take you on a brief journey through our company’s story – where we began, how far we’ve come, and where we’re heading next.

Most people recognise us as a finance company – and that’s completely fair, considering how much we’ve grown in that space. But what often surprises people is that our roots are actually in the travel industry. Yes, really – when we first opened our doors, our mission was to help people explore the world. It’s fascinating to see how that spirit of exploration has stayed with us, even as we shifted focus.

Over the past few years, we've undergone some exciting changes – adapting to a fast-moving world, expanding our services, and staying true to what makes us unique. And now, as we look to the future, we’re more committed than ever to innovation, partnership, and delivering real value to our clients. To wrap up, my key mission in BonVoyager is to increase the experience of our customers by creating a spetecular travel and that is how the profits come.

It’s fascinating to see how that spirit of exploration has stayed with us, even as we shifted focus. And now, as we look to the future, we’re more committed than ever to innovation, partnership, and delivering real value to our clients. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words. Response: From_
ToAll
Hello,

As you know, I need your help preparing a short presentation about the company for new recruits. Can you write up a short speech? Try to make it engaging; I don't want just a boring list of facts. Some key points to include:

• Frisko Shipping was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko.

• locations in 20 cities all over the world

• more than 5,000 employees

• our profit of 5 million dollars last year and 10 percent of the global market

• New employees are expected to be motivated and enthusiastic.

It might be useful to hold a quiz to see how much they already know about the company.

They might want to know something about me, so you can tell them about the time I fell into the ocean and was bitten by a shark. If you remember that story, you know that the passing ship that saved my life inspired me to start my own shipping company. Hopefully they'll see that as evidence that they can find inspiration anywhere.

And make sure to conclude the presentation by getting them to think and act. Please send me a draft of the speech by the end of tomorrow. Thanks!

Best regards,

Bill

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: The pilot should first make certain that the landing gear selector switch is in the GEAR DOWN position.
The pilot should then turn on the battery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked.
The landing gear should be retracted after liftoff when the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure.
Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in the GEAR DOWN position.
The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase.
During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel.
The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operation as well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit.
text_b: The pilot should first make certain that the landing gear selector switch is in theGEAR DOWNposition. The pilot should then turn on the battery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked. The landing gear should be retracted after liftoffwhen the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure. Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in theGEAR DOWNposition. The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase. During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel. The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operationas well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: New language learners have the opportunity to step into a new world, a new culture and  a new future .There is no doubt that this new adventure have so many issues and challenges. Each language has its  own rules, structure. If you are  a foreigner it is not  easy to adopt the grammar unless your main language is similar.
During learning a new language, grammar is one of the main difficulty. In order to emphasize the meanings, feelings, emotions, information  properly , a correct sequence of sentence is needed. Subject, verb, object is the main sequence for most of the languages.
No doubt that It's taken new language learners a while to  get used to the vocabulary and the pronunciation as well . 
Sometimes, similar sounds cause misunderstanding of the real meaning of what is being emphasized.
Listening music in a new language , watching TV series with subtitles, attending to the group or private speaking  courses are the strategies of learning and improving a new language.
text_b: New language learners have the opportunity to step into a new world, a new cultureand a new future .There is no doubt that this new adventure have so many issues and challenges. Each language has its own rules, structure. If you are a foreignerit is not easy to adopt the grammar unless your main language is similar. During learning a new language, grammar is one of the main difficulty. In order to emphasize the meanings, feelings, emotions, information properly , a correct sequence of sentence is needed. Subject, verb, object is the main sequence for most of the languages. No doubt that It's taken new language learners a while to get used to the vocabulary and the pronunciation as well . Sometimes, similar sounds cause misunderstanding of the real meaning of what is being emphasized. Listening music in a new language , watching TV series with subtitles, attending to the group or private speaking courses are the strategies of learning and improving a new language.
