Prompt Level: 12.0 Prompt: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication.

For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot – you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true.

I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way!
text_b: I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication. For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot – you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true. I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way!

It was a short stay, just a couple of days, a different gateaway than the classic mountain trip.

They decided to stay in a Riad, a typical moroccan house inside the Medina old city centre. The location was perfetct, just  a cuple of streets away from the the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square.

The first day they explored the maze-like alleys of the Medina, and wandered the souks in search of little treasure to bring home. Spices, silk, ceramics and all kind of trinkets filled the stands to the brim.
Still the best part of the holiday remained the one day trip to the desert.

They departed early in the morning, the city was calm and silent still asleep in the early hours, such a contrast to the buzzing  and bustling evenings!
Halfaway the car ride they had a stop to a local Argan shop; it was a only female traditional company. They watched them make all argan byproducts, oil but also marmalade, butter an honey. I'd never imagined there were so much different things made of it!

After enjoyung a nice mint tea an some typical pastry they boarded the bus to reach their true destination. Near a rural village the cap was set; after setting their stuff they prepared for the camel ride in the desert. Imangine: a whole grop of 10 adults wobbling an shuffling prcauriosly on top of their mighty steeds, it must have been hilarious!
The dinner was served at the sunset all typical food, chicken and lamb tajines, cous cous, soups and bread and at the end the mandatory mint tea obviously! They watched a beatiful show of mroccan songs and dancing and even a fire show just before retiring for the night.

Last but not least they wake up around 1 a.m. to watch the night sky; without the light pollution and in the endless plains of the desert surrounding them the number of stars was countless!

As their trip came to an end, they promised to return to Morocco to visit all the other missing city from Casablanca to Rabat. For the time being they wait for their next adventure, Istanbul here they come!
text_b: Last year during the winter holyday a friend of mineFedericotravelled with a group of friend to Marrakesh, Morocco. It was a short stay, just a couple of days, a different gateaway than the classic mountain trip. They decided to stay in a Riad, a typical moroccan house inside the Medina old city centre. The location was perfetct, just a cuple of streets away from the the famous Jemaa el-Fnaa square. The first day they explored the maze-like alleys of the Medina, and wandered the souks in search of little treasure to bring home. Spices, silk, ceramicsand all kind of trinkets filled the stands to the brim. Stillthe best part of the holiday remained the oneday trip to the desert. They departed early in the morning, the city was calm and silentstill asleep in the early hours, such a contrast to the buzzing and bustling evenings! Halfaway the car ridethey had a stop to a local Argan shop; it was a only female traditional company. They watched them make all argan byproducts, oil but also marmalade, butteran honey. I'd never imagined there were so much different things made of it! After enjoyung a nice mint tea an some typical pastrythey boarded the bus to reach their true destination. Near a rural villagethe cap was set; after setting their stuffthey prepared for the camel ride in the desert. Imangine: a whole grop of 10 adults wobbling an shuffling prcauriosly on top of their mighty steeds, it must have been hilarious! The dinner was served at the sunset all typical food, chicken and lamb tajines, cous cous, soups and breadand at the end the mandatory mint tea obviously! They watched a beatiful show of mroccan songs and dancing and even a fire show just before retiring for the night. Last but not leastthey wake up around 1 a.m. to watch the night sky; without the light pollution and in the endless plains of the desert surrounding themthe number of stars was countless! As their trip came to an end, they promised to return to Morocco to visit all the other missing city from Casablanca to Rabat. For the time beingthey wait for their next adventure, Istanbul here they come!

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Babi Ngepet or Boar demon is one of the famous urban legends in Indonesia especially in Java and Bali regions. The Local people know that Babi ngepet is a human who transforms himself into a boar and steal the money at night. An expert believe this urban legend emerged for the first time in 1830-1870 or during Dutch Colonialism in Indonesia. At that time, local Indonesian farmers were forced by the Dutch government to plant some valuable spices like peppers, ginger, tobacco etc (known as Cultuurstelsel). Those spices were exported to European countries. The practice of Cultuurstelsel created a suddenly rich local people especially the traders. The local farmers were suspicious that the traders used a black magic to get a lot of money (that’s a Babi ngepet) and became a very wealthy person.

This urban legend is believed & still popular among local people until now. In 2021, people who lived near the capital city were surprised by the emerge of black boar that was roaming at the street and captured by CCTV at night. At the same time, there was a man, who lived near the location, claimed that he lost a lot of money. The news and the video were then viral in Social Media. Police investigated the case and revealed that the man who lost the money was actually spread the hoax news to Social media to get attention from the people. The motif to commit this crime was because he was jealous with his neighbor that looked so wealthy, but rarely went outside for work.

At that time, local Indonesian farmers were forced by the Dutch government to plant some valuable spices like peppers, ginger, tobacco etc (known as Cultuurstelsel). Those spices were exported to European countries. The practice of Cultuurstelsel created a suddenly rich local peopleespecially the traders. The local farmers were suspicious that the traders used a black magic to get a lot of money (that’s a Babi ngepet) and became a very wealthy person. This urban legend is believed & still popular among local people until now. In 2021, people who lived near the capital city were surprised by the emerge of black boar that was roaming at the street and captured by CCTV at night. At the same time, there was a man, who lived near the location, claimed that he lost a lot of money. The news and the video were then viral in Social Media. Police investigated the case and revealed that the man who lost the money was actually spread the hoax news to Social media to get attention from the people. The motif to commit this crime was because he was jealous with his neighbor that looked so wealthy, but rarely went outside for work.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. Response: This report describes the april 13, 2025, landing involving Cessna 123's landing, New York City, after an almost
complete loss of thrust in both engines following an encounter with a flock of birds. The 150 passengers,
including a lap-held child, and 5 crewmembers evacuated the airplane by the forward and overwing exits.
One flight attendant and four passengers were seriously injured, and the airplane was substantially
damaged.
Safety issues discussed in this report include in-flight engine diagnostics, engine bird-ingestion
certification testing, emergency and abnormal checklist design, dual-engine failure and ditching training,
training on the effects of flight envelope limitations on airplane response to pilot inputs, validation of
operational procedures and requirements for airplane ditching certification, and wildlife hazard
mitigation. The report also discusses survival-related issues, including passenger brace positions;
slide/raft stowage; passenger immersion protection; life line usage; life vest stowage, retrieval, and
donning; preflight safety briefings; and passenger education. Safety recommendations concerning these
issues are addressed to the Federal Aviation Administration, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and the
European Aviation Safety Agency.
text_b: This report describes the april 13, 2025, landing involving Cessna 123's landing, New York City, after an almost complete loss of thrust in both engines following an encounter with a flock of birds. The 150 passengers, including a lap-held child, and 5 crewmembers evacuated the airplane by the forward and overwing exits. One flight attendant and four passengers were seriously injured, and the airplane was substantially damaged. Safety issues discussed in this report include in-flight engine diagnostics, engine bird-ingestion certification testing, emergency and abnormal checklist design, dual-engine failure and ditching training, training on the effects of flight envelope limitations on airplane response to pilot inputs, validation of operational procedures and requirements for airplane ditching certification, and wildlife hazard mitigation. The report also discusses survival-related issues, including passenger brace positions; slide/raft stowage; passenger immersion protection; life line usage; life vest stowage, retrieval, and donning; preflight safety briefings; and passenger education. Safety recommendations concerning these issues are addressed to the Federal Aviation Administration, the U.S. Department of Agriculture, and the European Aviation Safety Agency.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You see a niche in the hotel market and decide to write a business proposal for investors. Write the **strategic summary** and **risk assessment** sections of the proposal using the notes. Write 140–200 words. Response: Strategic Summary
The idea for Zen, our planned $4million “boutique” hotel, which will encapsulate a spa and health and fitness center came from recent market research by the AccomData Group. While there has been a growing trend in weekend getaway to relaxing resorts as well as greater attention to a healthy lifestyle, surveys show that most fitness centers offer an unsatisfying cuisine. This is why on addition to fully equipped gyms and swimming pools with trained instructors, Zen will also offer a healthy menu elaborated by elite chefs from the world’s most renowned restaurants. 
With the construction time estimated to take just two years, we foresee a return on investment by the second year after opening and a projected yearly profit of $1 million after that, which means that in just four years from opening the initial investment will be recouped and from then onwards we foresee only profits.
Risk Assessment
We have carried out a comprehensive risk assessment which has factored any potential economic downturn in the figures presented. Should the economy remain stable, the period required for recouping investment and realizing profits could be halved. To ensure the best possible initial outcome, we have planned an intensive media campaign being carried out by Kudos Advertising Agency.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) came into force in January 1994, after years of negotiation, creating a trilateral trade bloc between the United States, Canada, and Mexico.
 Its primary aim was to reduced or eliminated customs duties among the members such as tariffs, and foster economic integration among the three nations. The NAFTA has had a profound impact on trade relations, especially in agriculture; for example, Mexican fruits and vegetables flow into the US.Additionally, NAFTA encouraged foreign direct investment, enhancing the competitiveness of industries within the bloc.
NAFTA also faced criticism. Critics pointed to job losses in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing, due to companies relocating to Mexico for cheaper labor. Environmental concerns and the exploitation of workers were also points of contention.
In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which updated key provisions to address modern trade challenges. NAFTA remains a significant milestone in North American economic history, exemplifying the potential and complexities of regional trade agreements.
text_b: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) came into force in January 1994, after years of negotiation, creating a trilateral trade bloc between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. Its primary aim was to reduced or eliminated customs duties among the memberssuch as tariffs, and foster economic integration among the three nations. The NAFTA has had a profound impact on trade relations, especially in agriculture; for example, Mexican fruits and vegetables flow into the US.Additionally, NAFTA encouraged foreign direct investment, enhancing the competitiveness of industries within the bloc. NAFTA also faced criticism. Critics pointed to job losses in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing, due to companies relocating to Mexico for cheaper labor. Environmental concerns and the exploitation of workers were also points of contention. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which updated key provisions to address modern trade challenges. NAFTA remains a significant milestone in North American economic history, exemplifying the potential and complexities of regional trade agreements.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible. Response: The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong has grown continously over the past six months, due to investment from Mainland China. By now, it is on it´s all-time high at nearly 28,000 points.

The reason for the developmenet seem to be that Properties and Utilities Sub-indices have risen dramatically, due to growth from China which still has a strong influence on the economics in Hong Kong. 

But the development hasn´t been as strong ever since the last year. Only a half year ago the index dropped from 26,000 below 21,000 in a very short period of time, but since then the index has gone up rose to a high of 27,499.

It is always hard to predict the future development, but experts seem to be optimistic that the index will continue rising. Main reasons for this are strong indicators such as massive investment from other countries, as well as Hong Kong’s internal demand.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: The landing gear should be retracted after liftoff when the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure.
Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in the GEAR DOWN position.
The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase.
During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel.
The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operation as well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit.
In most airplanes, the gear switch is shaped like a wheel in order to facilitate positive identification and to differentiate it from other cockpit controls.
A landing gear safety switch, sometimes referred to as asquat switch, is usually mounted in a bracket on one of the main gear shock struts.
The pilot should then turn on thebattery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked.
text_b: The landing gear should be retracted after liftoff when the airplane has reached an altitude where the airplane could no longer be landed on the runway if there is a power failure. Landing gear is extended by placing the gear selector switch in the GEAR DOWN position. The airspeed will decrease and the pitch attitude may increase. During the several seconds it takes for the gear to extend, the pilot should be attentive to any abnormal sounds or feel. The pilot should confirm that the landing gear has extended and locked by the normal sound and feel of the system operation as well as by the gear position indicators in the cockpit. In most airplanes, the gear switch is shaped like a wheel in order to facilitate positive identification and to differentiate it from other cockpit controls. A landing gear safety switch, sometimes referred to as asquat switch, is usually mounted in a bracket on one of the main gear shock struts. The pilot should then turn on thebattery master switch and ensure that the landing gear position indicators show that the gear is down and locked.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: In France, robots are used in various sectors and improve the efficiency and safety of activities, their main uses are :
In industry to automate repetitive tasks to improve productivity, accuracy and working conditions. The negative aspect is that the low-skilled people who used these tasks before the use of robots no longer have a job and are difficult to reclassify.
In agriculture for cattle milking, cleaning and feeding, in wine production and market gardening, these autonomous robots reduce the use of chemical weed killers and preserve the soil.

For healthcare, robots can help surgeons with complex or remote procedures.
French companies are developing exoskeletons that allow paraplegics to regain mobility, or to help workers to carry heavy loads.

For security and emergency response, they allow access to dangerous areas without risk to firefighters, police or military.

Robotics in France is booming, in my opinion the only negative aspect being, as mentioned earlier, that it takes jobs away from low-skilled people who are difficult to reemploy.

Robots associated with AI will continue to advance in proportions that are difficult to imagine.

The negative aspect is that the low-skilled people who used these tasks before the use of robots no longer have a job and are difficult to reclassify. In agriculture for cattle milking, cleaningand feeding, in wine production and market gardening, these autonomous robots reduce the use of chemical weed killers and preserve the soil. For healthcare, robots can help surgeons with complex or remote procedures. French companies are developing exoskeletons that allow paraplegics to regain mobility, or to help workers to carry heavy loads. For security and emergency response, they allow access to dangerous areas without risk to firefighters, policeor military. Robotics in France is booming, in my opinionthe only negative aspect being, as mentioned earlier, that it takes jobs away from low-skilled people who are difficult to reemploy. Robots associated with AI will continue to advance in proportions that are difficult to imagine.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: The fuselage is the body of the airplane, it have the form of a tube and the inside is the cabin with the crew and passengers. In the bottom of the fuselage is where the baggage and cargo is stored. 
Landing gear is at the bottom of the fuselage and is retracted when the airplane is going to land. 
At the sides of the airplane are the wings. At the back of the wings are the flaps, that helps to increase the lifting force of the wings and slow down an airplane when it lands. 
The tails helps to the airplane stability. The vertical part is cal fin or vertical stabilizer and the rudder is the part of the airplane that moves to go right or left. The horizontal stabilizer can be move up or down to help the airplane to go up or down. 
The engines are located on the sides of the airplane. They commonly are of piston and gas turbine.

At the sides of the airplane are the wings. At the back of the wings are the flaps, that helps to increase the lifting force of the wings and slow down an airplane when it lands. The tails helps to the airplanestability. The vertical part is cal fin or vertical stabilizerand the rudder is the part of the airplane that moves to go right or left. The horizontal stabilizer can be move up or down to help the airplane to go up or down. The engines are located on the sides of the airplane. They commonly are of piston and gas turbine.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Harry, 
Here are some tips for motivating your team, I included some things to avoid too.

• Listen, be a good listener it’s important. People want to a leader who actively listen then, be about the problems or solutions.

• Be empathetic with your employees, put yourself in their shoes and try to understand the situation when they disagree with something.

• Incentivize and recognize your team. A reward always motivates people and they feel part of the company and most important, they feel that what they do it’s important for the company success.

And something’s to avoid demotivate your employees:

• Take credit for work done by you subordinates.
• Disrespect them because you are the boss.
• Lose your temper.
• Don’t recognize the people when they are doing a good work.
• Don’t be the example.

I hope that’s tips help you in this new journey, good luck with your team! 

Ellen

And something’s to avoid demotivate your employees: • Take credit for work done by you subordinates. • Disrespect them because you are the boss. • Lose your temper. • Don’t recognize the people when they are doing a good work. • Don’t be the example. text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Nowadays, thanks to technology and social development, plenty of robots have been created to serve people in many fields. One of the most significant robots is robot homes which are very well-known. They have positive and negative aspects. On the one hand, robot homes bring several benefits to us. First and foremost, people often have to do repetitive and boring jobs which makes them discouraged, however, home robots can replace humans to do these things because they are machines and they can operate without a break and provide all-day service. As a result, people will have more time for leisure activities, strengthening family bonding, hanging out with friendsor for their hobbieswhich helps them relax and feel more comfortable. Additionally, they can respond to many questions about many topics or provide informationwhich is very beneficial for us in work or study. Moreover, they are also entertainment tools because of their amazing abilities, they can interact and play games with peoplewhich brings exciting feelings for users. On the other hand, home robots also have some drawbacks. First, due to they can answer many questions or do many things, people are lazy and become dependent on AI technologies. According to many surveys, 80% of students nowadays are using AI for their studies. As a consequence, they may lose their critical thinking skills, and creative abilitiesand become passive in learning. In addition, AI doesn't always give correct informationwhich has adverse impacts on students. Last but not least, the cost of operating a robot is not easy to afford. In case of having problems, robots need expensive spare partsand they also need to be programmed to perform each task, therefore, if you have a software issue, you are not able to fix it yourself and need to hire a professional programmer. In conclusion, robots can make our lives better and bring us many advantages. However, if we overuse them, they can cause many drawbacks to us. Therefore, we need to use them for the right purpose to promote their abilities.

However, the more experience you gain, the easier it gets. You can advance your carrier path and earn a lot of money. So, the job is always safeand the effort pays off. Furthermore, your daily work is extremely fulfilling. Helping people is very rewarding. Best regards, A.

Could you please tell us what are your expectations once the website is out? It's important for us to know in order to choose what could work best for your specific needs, but is also important because we can create an strategy for the search engines so whenever a person looks for your product on the Internet, the website can make it to the top results. Additionally, it is also important that you specify the pages you want to include on the website, such as company page or product page. You can even include a testimonial page to show your costumers' experiences with the product. Please let us know as soon as possible in order to start working on your website. It is important to us to deliver on time! Best regards.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: I would like to test free writing, because it seems that it is a similar technique as Journaling, which can help with coping with stress. Free writing can be useful in many ways, like expressing thoughs and feelings in case of some emotionally demanding situation. I imagine, that after 10 minutes of writing, one’s feelings would calm down and thoughts would be more clear. Free writing can also help with clarifying my thoughts. When dealing with a complex issue, it happens that I have many ideas running in my head. After putting all my thoughts on paperI would reread the document and I will be able to list the main ideas to be explored. As a next step, I would be able to use the listing technique for problem solving. Focused free writing is another technique I used to practice, when I need to make a presentation or write a summary on a topic. I start to write all ideas what comes to my mind about it and then I start exploring the main ideas.

Consequently, please find below the following actions should be taken: ● US client designs: - It will be our high priority - Try to maintain US client working as before ● New hires: - We need to find replacements for two staffers which leave in Q2. - Let me know if anyone knows of a candidate. ● Marketing media reorganization: - Projects will be frozen for a period because it takes lot of work. I look forward to reading about the efforts of all of you. Best regards, Mª Luisa.

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: The NAFTA agreement is a regional trade agreement that was signed among the three Countries of North America: Canada, the United States, and Mexico. The agreement consists in improving trade policies among the three member states, and reducing (and in some cases eliminating) custom duties on agricultural goods. Although the agreement came into force in January 1994, it took many years to got it. In fact, the agreement has positive impacts on trade policies, especially for the less advantaged country, Mexico, which can export fruits and vegetables to the US market more easily and without paying taxes. In other words, the agreement facilitates different trade exchanges, but on the other hand can be seen like a brake from richer countries, like the US, that had political end economic power to impose custom duties. Overall, benefits are for all the threes member states, and the agreement has also became a guarantee of regional stability.

text_a: Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: My friend Anya has always been a bit of a magnet for the unusual. But nothing prepared her for the day when the sky rained teacups. Yes, You read that right. It was a Sunday afternoon, the kind where the sun shines and human lazes around. Anya was looking at her dog,Leowho was jollying around in the backyard of her home. Suddenly, a gentle clinking sound started, and before they knew it, delicate porcelain teacups of all shapes and sizes began to fall from the clear blue sky. Leo, initially startled, started batting at the descending crockery with his paws, while Anya could only stare updards in bewildered amusement. People around her also stopped doing everything and looked up in aweand a few tried to catch the teacups, resulting in a few comical clatters. Anya managed to snag a beautiful floral one, miraculously intact. The teacup rain lasted for around 10 minutes, ceasing as abruptly as it began. The park was left with porcelain glittering in the sunlight. Noone could explain what just happened as there were no clouds or aeroplanes overhead from where these crockery could have possibly downpoured from. Anya still keeps that floral teacup on her mantlepiece as a constant remainder of the day when the skies decided to have a tea party.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: nan
text_b: Buying a house or a flat in my country is a very time-consuming process, and it costs lots of money, too, unless you settle for living in rural areas, or don't mind living in an extremely small appartment. House pricing has been steadily increasing during the last 20 years or so, and there is no end in sight . In order to buy a houseyou contact a real estate agency of your choice. When making a contract, you need to pay a large part of the total price up front. In most cases, the buyer needs a loan, which is provided by ordinary banks. The real estate agent helps in contacting the bank, in particular, the appartment to be bought will serve as an asset which then guarantees that the buyer will be able to pay back the loan (actuallythe bank acquires the real estate asset if you fail to make your loan payments). When making the loan contract, you have to provide documents that prove your identity, your residence status, your employment status, your recent income, as well as your recent savings account history. If there are no problems and the loan contract is approved, the real estate purchase contract will be made. The seller receives the remaining payment immediately, but you then usually pay off the loan in monthly rates, and in many cases it will take more than 10 years - up to 30 years - to pay it off. The loan itself may use fixed or flexible interest rates, where fixed rates were as low as 1.0% a couple of years ago, but have risen to more than 2.5% lately.

text_b: Dear all, I have completed my investigation into your staff’s lack of compliance with the code of conduct. Here are my findings: Male employees regularly smoke in the toilet. Many female employees do not abide by the dress code (jeans, short skirts, etc.). Certain employees are often late for work. Workspaces are not clean and tidy; in fact, they are messy. Confidential documents are often taken out of the office. It seems obvious to me a new code of conduct is needed, and I think you should write it ASAP. Something needs to be done! Regards, Jonathon Dimbleby

text_a: Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: We have been looking at two training companies: TrainQuick and Skills Pro. TrainQuick is cheap and flexible, but people aren't using it in the other branch. Employees don't like it when we mix them with people from other branches in their classes. Skills Pro is more expensive. People have described the course content as difficult, but people who take the course often finish it successfully. They plan to expand the course, too. If you just look at the costs, it might sound tempting to consider TrainQuick. We would be offering training to our employees in a costeffective way, with a risk of a lot of cancellations during the training. But if we are aiming for getting the most out of the training of our employees, I would recommend Skills Pro. That way we get more value four our moneywith our employees being educated and also finishing the class.
